title: Director of Maintenance
description:
Looking for a career where you can make a difference in someone else’s life? Where opportunities abound to advance your future, both personally and professionally? The Bristal Assisted Living is the place for you. You’ll thrive in a premier senior care organization that values you as an individual — not just your experience and skillsets, but your unique talents and energy. You’ll enrich the community in which you work, and that community will enrich you. We call what we do at The Bristal “hospitality with a higher purpose.” We know you’ll make an impactful difference. Because the difference is you. *Come join us!*

We are seeking an experienced, hands-on **Director of Maintenance** to coordinate and lead the Maintenance Department and all associated maintenance team members. The ideal candidate will be thorough and meticulous and will pay extraordinary attention to detail in ensuring the highest standards of maintenance excellence.

**Additional responsibilities include:**

* Coordinating and assuring performance of all preventative maintenance schedules
* Visually inspecting all common areas on a daily basis to ascertain and cover all maintenance needs
* Scheduling, delegating and managing all maintenance work orders and technicians
* Setting up periodic inspections of the entire property, including checking such areas as the roof, building façade, parking lots, grounds, signs, etc.
* Prioritizing, initiating and supervising all maintenance work, including maintaining up-to-date repair records on all equipment as well as maintaining up-to-date work lists per job to ensure all work is conducted and completed in a timely and effective manner
* Initiating a training program to ensure training is implemented and completed by all maintenance technicians
* Inspecting all firefighting equipment in a periodic manner in accordance with all requirements by law
* Operating and maintaining all buildings and grounds as well as all security and transportation systems in accordance with federal, state, and local OSHA standards
* Inspecting vacated apartments and completing the painting, repairing and general refurbishment within the prescribed timeframe
* Overseeing and reviewing all maintenance work performed, whether conducted by team members or outside contractors, and maintaining cleanliness checklists.
* Heading up the Safety Committee
* Responding to maintenance emergencies 24/7/365, as needed
* Maintaining grounds and external areas of building, including and not limited to sprinkler systems, outside lights, driveway and parking lots, ensuring all remain in clean and working condition
* Conducting continuing education regarding maintenance techniques and standards, including the use of chemicals
* Performing hands-on repairs and working alongside Maintenance Technicians for basic preventive maintenance of HVAC systems, electrical, plumbing, carpentry, painting, sheetrock and snow removal

Full-time schedule requires working one weekend day per week (Tues-Sat).

*Salary commensurate with experience*

**Qualifications:**

* A minimum of five (5) years’ experience as a supervisor, with documented evidence of a varied range of maintenance skills and abilities
* Experience with HVAC, plumbing, carpentry and general maintenance
* Maintenance for a large residential community, hotel, hospitality, assisted living or similar industry experience preferred
* Must demonstrate skills in all phases of building and equipment maintenance, cleanliness and repairs
* Skilled in the selection and management of maintenance team members for meeting the needs of the entire community
* Acceptable working knowledge of Microsoft Office
* Experience working in a facility with a senior/ geriatric population a plus
* A true friendly and customer-service-oriented attitude and demeanor when working with team members, management, residents and their families

**Benefits include:**

* Salary increases based on annual performance
* Annual team appreciation events, quarterly team appreciation bonuses, and an annual holiday bonus
* 401K plan
* AFLAC Benefits
* Company-paid life insurance policy
* PTO days, company-paid holidays, with a PTO cash-out option annually
* Optional lunch for all employees
* Available health, dental and vision coverage

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $83,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Weekends as needed

Application Question(s):

* What are your salary expectations?

Experience:

* Maintenance: 5 years (Required)
* Management: 3 years (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* East Meadow, NY 11554 (Preferred)

Work Location: In person
company_description: The Bristal Assisted Living is the premier in senior living with 24 locations throughout the tri-state area inlcuding Long Island, Westchester, Manhattan, and New Jersey.

title: Hair Artisan
company: Blo out lounge and colour bar
description:
**Job Title: Artisan**

**Location:** blō Out Lounge & Colour Bar, Hamilton

**Overview:**

Are you passionate about beautiful hair and exceptional guest experiences? Join us at blō Out Lounge & Colour Bar as an Artisan. We are a thriving luxury salon committed to delivering top-notch services and a unique guest experience. As an Artisan, you'll blend your cut and color expertise with our vibrant salon culture, helping our guests discover and love their hair. Whether they’ve had a look for 10 years or 10 minutes, you’ll ensure they leave blō Out Lounge & Colour Bar looking and more importantly, feeling better than when they first came in.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Color Expertise:** Utilize our Kevin Murphy, Davines, and Redken Shades color lines to create the color and tones of our guests’ dreams. From root touch-ups to balayages, each color and look is personalized to our guests after thorough consultations each visit.
* **Masterful Haircuts:** Deliver precision haircuts that reflect client preferences and enhance their natural beauty.
* **Exceptional Customer Service:** Provide personalized consultations, ensuring every guest leaves with a smile and confidence in their look.
* **Continuous Learning:** Embrace ongoing training and education opportunities to stay ahead in the latest trends and techniques.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work closely with colleagues to foster a supportive and positive salon environment.
* **Professionalism:** Maintain high standards of professionalism, punctuality, and respect for clients and team members.
* **Lounge Cleanliness:** Adhere to salon safety protocols and cleanliness standards.
* **Trend Awareness:** Stay updated on the latest hairstyle trends to bring innovative ideas to the salon.

**Performance Goals:**

* **Creative Problem Solving:** Address and resolve guest concerns effectively to ensure high satisfaction.
* **Guest Satisfaction:** Achieve positive feedback and high ratings through outstanding service.
* **Guest Retention:** Maintain a strong rate of returning guests through exceptional service and care.
* **Service and Retail Sales:** Meet revenue targets and contribute to Lounge profitability through effective sales strategies.
* **Ongoing Education:** Complete required technical and business training to enhance skills and career growth.

**Additional Responsibilities:**

* **Team Engagement:** Participate in team meetings and educational classes.
* **Collaboration:** Work with the Front Desk and Artisan Assistants to ensure smooth operations.
* **Social Media:** Contribute to our social media presence, showcasing your work and engaging with our community.

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:** At least 1 year of hands-on experience in the cosmetology field.
* **Certification:** Valid NJ cosmetology license.
* **Skills:** Strong customer service skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work well in a team environment.

**Benefits:**

* **Education:** Access to multiple classes monthly from various educators to enhance your skills. Opportunities to teach guests and increase income.
* **Career Growth:** A strong guest base, a sliding commission scale, and continued opportunities to excel provide career advancement and income stability.
* **Flexibility:** Customized scheduling to support a work/life balance and personal growth.
* **Team Support and Culture:** Our team culture and focus on being a team based organization makes us stand-out. We want to grow together as individuals and as a group, and are grounded by our shared values. Don’t just take our word for it; we were a *Salon Today* Salon 200 2024 Salon Culture Honoree!

**Job Types:** Full-time, Part-time

If you're ready to bring your hair artistry and expertise to a salon that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous growth, apply now to start your journey with blō Out Lounge & Colour Bar!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
A rapidly growing auto parts distributor in the Northern New Jersey area has an immediate opening in our Lodi, NJ location for a hard-working Customer Service representative with opportunity to advance and play a key role.

This auto parts distributor sells and delivers automotive cooling parts to auto mechanics, collision repair shops, distributors, individual customers and car dealerships. This position would be full time.

Salary is hourly with additional incentives such as bonus and commission. 401K Plan available

Primary Responsibilities would include but not be limited to:

Answer 80-120 inbound calls per day from customers looking for price, availability, and delivery information

Taking customer service calls from wholesale customers and developing valuable repeat buyer customer accounts while maintaining high customer satisfaction using excellent customer service skills

Follow up on customer quotes.

Communicate important customer relationship issues with team members and management.

Our ideal candidate has the following skills and experience:  
Previous customer service and/or sales experience  
- Good data entry skills and basic computer skills  
- Strong communication skills  
- Call center, customer service or sales experience a must  
- Knowledge of automotive industry or cars in general may be a plus but is not required  
- Spanish speaking a plus

This is a great opportunity for someone who is willing to learn the automotive distributor business from the ground up, eager to take on additional responsibility and is professional and energetic. We offer an exciting, fast-paced work environment. We are looking for someone who can wear a lot of hats and help manage every facet of this business.

If interested in learning more, please respond today. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and offer a clean, drug and smoke free environment.

title: Medical Front Office Administrator
description:
Our highly successful private practice is seeking a highly organized and friendly Medical Front Office Administrator to join our healthcare team. As a front office administrator, you will be the first point of contact for patients and medical reps providing exceptional customer service while efficiently managing administrative tasks. Your role will be critical in creating a positive and welcoming environment for our patients and visitors.

Responsibilities:

* Greet patients and visitors warmly, ensuring a friendly and professional atmosphere in the reception area.
* Answer phone calls, schedule appointments, and manage the appointment calendar to optimize patient flow
* Verify patient information and insurance details accurately during registration.
* Collect patient co-pays and process payments following established protocols.
* Update and maintain patient records, ensuring all information is current and accurate.
* Coordinate with medical staff to ensure smooth patient check-ins, referrals, and follow-ups.
* Assist in managing patient inquiries, resolving concerns, and directing them to the appropriate departments when necessary.
* Keep the reception area and waiting room tidy and organized.
* Handle incoming and outgoing mail, faxes, and other administrative duties as required.
* Adhere to all privacy and confidentiality regulations concerning patient information.

Requirements:

* High school diploma or equivalent. Additional education and or in medical administration is a plus.
* Proven experience as a Medical Receptionist or in a similar role.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Bilingual Spanish preferred
* Punctuality is essential
* Exceptional customer service abilities, demonstrating empathy and patience.
* Proficiency in computer systems and electronic medical records (EMR) software.
* Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
* Attention to detail and accuracy in maintaining records and patient information.
* Familiarity with medical terminology and basic knowledge of insurance verification.
* Professional appearance and demeanor. Ability to work as part of a team and collaborate effectively with medical staff and colleagues.

Preferred Qualifications:

* Previous experience in a healthcare setting ideal.

We look forward to reviewing your application and potentially welcoming you to our team. This is a full-time position, Monday-Friday, about 40 hours per week, some overtime. Full time positions are entitled to benefits such as paid vacation, sick days, medical and dental benefits

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $24.00 - $28.00 per hour

Benefits:

* Health insurance
* Paid time off

* Endocrinology
* Internal Medicine

* Monday to Friday

title: Snack Bar Attendant
description:

title: Technical Account Manager, Enterprise East
description:
**Get to know Okta**  

  

Okta is The World's Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth.  

  

At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we're looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.  

  

Join our team! We're building a world where Identity belongs to you.

**The Team:**



Technical Account Management is a global team that partners with Okta's Customer Success team and collaborates with Okta's customers to share knowledge, best practices and make recommendations to continuously innovate around identity and security. We are Okta product experts, and we enable Okta's worldwide growth by educating existing customers and ensuring they are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers through presentations, demonstrations, technical evaluations, and ongoing recommendations on Okta and industry best practices.


**The Opportunity:**



A Technical Account Manager (TAM) specializing in enterprise identity, including Okta's Workforce Identity Cloud (WIC), Customer Identity Cloud (CIC) and adjacent technologies. The TAM will provide Okta's customers with strategic technical guidance over the comprehensive suite of products and features available at Okta. They are held in high regard as a technical expert for how Okta's solutions translate to business value.



The TAM specialization calls for an understanding of hybrid scenarios that capitalize on Okta's ability to manage authentication, authorization and lifecycle management capabilities for SaaS, on-premise and custom enterprise applications.


**You Will:**


* Advise customers on best practices and product adoption in a post-sales capacity
* Partner with Customer Success Managers and serve as their technical counterpart on a defined book of business, largely midmarket
* Earn customer trust by understanding their goals and use cases, and recommend best practices relating to process changes, product adoption, configuration and additional features to meet requirements
* Maintain focus on increasing subscription adoption, customer satisfaction and retention
* Review customer architectures and Okta configurations to ensure they are enhancing security posture and capturing ROI as Okta releases new features and functionality
* Take and respond to reactive questions from Customer Success Managers
* Establish strong personal relationships on key accounts with decision-makers and stakeholders
* Participate in content creation for both internal and external enablement of staff and customers


**Requirements:**


* 2+ years of total experience in information technology, with at least 3 years of hands-on experience as a Technical Account Manager (TAM) or comparable practitioner role in the IAM space
* Familiarity with IAM technologies and protocols, enterprise SaaS applications, lifecycle management scenarios, and security is strongly desired
* Experience in any of the following: Technical Account Management, Technical Consulting, Product Management, Solution Architect, or similar role is a plus.
* Understanding of common software development practice. Understanding of identity and surrounding technologies.
* Experience owning customer relationships and escalations
* Excellent communication skills. Ability to set expectations and communicate goals and objectives with customers at various levels, from a developer to a CIO
* Ability to track and influence customer behavior and health metrics across a portfolio of accounts
* This position will be located remotely but requires you reside and work in Eastern time zone and will have some travel required (under 25% of time)


#LI-Remote



#LI-BF1

**What you can look forward to as an Full-Time Okta employee!**


* Amazing Benefits
* Making Social Impact
* Fostering Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging at Okta


Okta cultivates a dynamic work environment, providing the best tools, technology and benefits to empower our employees to work productively in a setting that best and uniquely suits their needs. Each organization is unique in the degree of flexibility and mobility in which they work so that all employees are enabled to be their most creative and successful versions of themselves, regardless of where they live. Find your place at Okta today! https://www.okta.com/company/careers/.



Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, marital status, age, physical or mental disability, or status as a protected veteran. We also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and convictions records, consistent with applicable laws. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, please use this Form to request an accommodation.



Okta is committed to complying with applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations. For more information, please see our Privacy Policy at https://www.okta.com/privacy-policy/.
company_description: Okta is the foundation for secure connections between people and technology.

title: Multi-Product Strategy Associate
description:
**ABOUT FANDUEL**



FanDuel Group ("FanDuel") is an innovative sports-tech entertainment company that is changing the way consumers engage with their favorite sports, teams, and leagues. The premier gaming destination in the United States, FanDuel consists of a portfolio of leading brands across gaming, sports betting, daily fantasy sports, advance-deposit wagering, and TV/media.



FanDuel has a presence across all 50 states with approximately 17 million customers and 28 retail locations. FanDuel is based in New York with offices in New Jersey, Georgia, California, Oregon, Canada and Scotland.



Its networks FanDuel TV and FanDuel+ are broadly distributed on linear cable television and through its relationships with leading direct-to-consumer over-the-top platforms.



FanDuel Group is a subsidiary of Flutter Entertainment plc, the world's largest sports betting and gaming operator with a portfolio of globally recognized brands and traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: FLUT).


**THE ROSTER**



At FanDuel, we give fans a new and innovative way to interact with their favorite games, sports and teams. We're dedicated to building a winning team and we pride ourselves on being able to make every moment mean more, especially when it comes to your career. So, what does "winning" look like at FanDuel? It's recognition for your hard-earned results, a culture that brings out your best work—and a roster full of talented coworkers. Make no mistake, we are here to win, but we believe in winning right. That means we'll never compromise when it comes to looking out for our teammates. From creatives professionals to cutting edge technology innovators, FanDuel offers a wide range of career opportunities, best in class benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. At FanDuel, our principle of "We Are One Team" runs through all our offices across the globe, and you can expect to be a part of an exciting company with many opportunities to grow and be successful.


**THE POSITION**  

Our roster has an opening with your name on it



FanDuel is seeking an individual to assist in developing strategy and executing multi-product play initiatives across Sportsbook and Casino. In this highly collaborative role, you will support efforts to cross-sell Sportsbook users over to FanDuel's online Casino and maintain ongoing play across both products. You should be highly organized and comfortable with managing multiple priorities, working with many stakeholders across the business, and thinking strategically.


**THE GAME PLAN**  

Everyone on our team has a part to play


* Collaborate with various stakeholders to assist in the development of multi-product play campaigns, using data-driven insights to help construct offers, target audience segments, communications touchpoints, and overall marketing strategy
* Support Senior Associate with management of campaign and testing roadmaps, keeping them up-to-date based on the latest plans
* Drive campaign execution, including requests and ongoing collaboration with other teams
* Draft creative briefs that clearly articulate the context and intent of campaigns; manage feedback and revisions process
* Work with Casino and Sportsbook stakeholders to manage schedule of Casino content in the Sportsbook app
* Support in the development of multi-product-play campaign automations across Sportsbook and Casino lifecycles
* Track and document competitor insights pertaining to multi-product play
* Facilitate or support on ad hoc requests and initiatives as needed


**THE STATS**  

What we're looking for in our next teammate


* Minimum 1+ years of project management or marketing experience preferred
* Bachelor's degree with strong academic record and/or proven relevant experience in a project management or marketing role
* Team player with the ability to collaborate and build strong relationships with many internal stakeholders
* Comfortable managing concurrent projects in an ever-evolving, fast-paced landscape
* Outstanding organizational skills, project management skills, and ability to multitask and prioritize
* Strong written and verbal communication with meticulous attention to detail
* Enthusiasm for strategic planning, creative thinking, and tactical execution

We treat our team right



From our many opportunities for professional development to our generous insurance and paid leave policies, we're committed to making sure our employees get as much out of FanDuel as we ask them to give. Competitive compensation is just the beginning. As part of our team, you can expect:

title: Personal Assistant
description:
**Job Summary:**

We are seeking a reliable and versatile Personal Assistant to support our busy household. This role combines personal assistance with housekeeping and childcare duties, making it ideal for someone who is organized, proactive, and enjoys working in a family environment. The successful candidate will help manage day-to-day tasks, maintain a clean and orderly home, and provide attentive care to our four children (ages 7, 4, and 10-month-old twins).

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Personal Assistance:**
* Assist with household management tasks, including organizing schedules, running errands, and managing household supplies.
* Provide support with coordinating children’s activities, appointments, and transportation needs.
* Communicate effectively with parents to ensure tasks are prioritized and completed efficiently.
* **Housekeeping:**
* Perform general housekeeping duties, including cleaning, tidying, laundry, and organizing various areas of the home.
* Ensure that the household remains clean, orderly, and comfortable for the family.
* **Childcare:**
* Provide loving and attentive care to our four children, ensuring their safety, well-being, and development.
* Engage in age-appropriate activities, including playing, reading, and assisting with homework for the older children.
* Manage daily routines, including feeding, diapering, and napping for the twins.
* **Meal Preparation:**
* Assist with meal planning and preparation, ensuring that healthy and nutritious meals are available for the family.
* Follow any dietary guidelines or preferences provided by the family.
* **Transportation:**
* Safely transport children to and from school, activities, or appointments as needed. A family car will be provided for this purpose.
* Ensure that the children arrive punctually and are properly secured in car seats or seat belts.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience as a personal assistant, housekeeper, or childcare provider, with references available upon request.
* Strong organizational and time-management skills, with the ability to multitask effectively.
* A nurturing and patient personality, with a genuine love for working with children.
* Valid driver’s license and a clean driving record.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and discretion regarding the family’s personal matters.
* CPR and First Aid certification is a plus.

**Additional Information:**

* The position is part-time, with working hours on Monday, Wednesday, some Fridays. Weekend flexible. Flexibility for occasional changes in schedule is appreciated.
* The role will involve a balance between personal assistance, housekeeping, and childcare, with priorities shifting based on the family’s needs.

If you are a proactive and dedicated individual who enjoys creating a warm and organized home environment while supporting a busy family, we would love to hear from you.

Job Type: Part-time

Expected hours: 20 – 30 per week

* Weekends as needed

* Microsoft Excel: 1 year (Preferred)
* Microsoft Powerpoint: 1 year (Preferred)

description:
**Job Title: Ouidad Artisan**

**Location:** blō Out Lounge & Colour Bar, Hamilton

**Overview:**

Are you passionate about curly hair and exceptional guest experiences? Join us at blō Out Lounge & Colour Bar as an Ouidad Artisan. We are a thriving luxury salon committed to delivering top-notch services and a unique guest experience. As an Ouidad Artisan, you'll blend your curl expertise with our vibrant salon culture, helping our guests embrace and enhance their natural curls.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Ouidad Expertise:** Utilize Ouidad’s specialized curl techniques and products to create stunning, personalized styles for our curly-haired guests.
* **Masterful Haircuts:** Deliver precision haircuts that reflect client preferences and enhance their natural beauty.
* **Exceptional Customer Service:** Provide personalized consultations, ensuring every guest leaves with a smile and confidence in their look.
* **Continuous Learning:** Embrace ongoing training and education opportunities to stay ahead in the latest trends and techniques.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work closely with colleagues to foster a supportive and positive salon environment.
* **Professionalism:** Maintain high standards of professionalism, punctuality, and respect for clients and team members.
* **Lounge Cleanliness:** Adhere to salon safety protocols and cleanliness standards.
* **Trend Awareness:** Stay updated on the latest hairstyle trends to bring innovative ideas to the salon.

**Performance Goals:**

* **Creative Problem Solving:** Address and resolve guest concerns effectively to ensure high satisfaction.
* **Guest Satisfaction:** Achieve positive feedback and high ratings through outstanding service.
* **Guest Retention:** Maintain a strong rate of returning guests through exceptional service and care.
* **Service and Retail Sales:** Meet revenue targets and contribute to Lounge profitability through effective sales strategies.
* **Ongoing Education:** Complete required technical and business training to enhance skills and career growth.

**Additional Responsibilities:**

* **Team Engagement:** Participate in team meetings and educational classes.
* **Collaboration:** Work with the Front Desk and Artisan Assistants to ensure smooth operations.
* **Social Media:** Contribute to our social media presence, showcasing your work and engaging with our community.

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:** At least 1 year of hands-on experience in the cosmetology field.
* **Certification:** Valid NJ cosmetology license and Ouidad certification as a curl specialist.
* **Skills:** Strong customer service skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work well in a team environment.

**Benefits:**

* **Education:** Access to multiple classes monthly from various educators to enhance your skills. Opportunities to teach guests and increase income.
* **Career Growth:** A strong guest base, a sliding commission scale, and curl-focused memberships provide career advancement and income stability.
* **Flexibility:** Customized scheduling to support a work/life balance and personal growth.

**Job Types:** Full-time, Part-time

If you're ready to bring your curl expertise to a salon that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous growth, apply now to start your journey with blō Out Lounge & Colour Bar!

**Apply today and let your passion for curly hair shine with us!**

title: Data Entry Specialist
description:
**Build an exciting career at Carvana as a Data Entry Specialist!**

  

**Benefits and Compensation:**  

* Competitive wage of $19 per hour
* Opportunity for up to 12% merit based hourly wage increase in year 1
* Available company paid medical benefits + dental, and vision benefits
* 104 Hours of PTO, 9 company paid holidays and your birthday is a holiday
* 401K with company match
* Student loan repayment program
* Employee vehicle discount
* Benefits for your pets
* Wellness programs for your physical, mental, financial, and social health
* Access to growth and development opportunities to expand your skill set and drive your career
  

**Job Description:**  

The Title and Registration Specialist role (Data Entry Specialist) is responsible for focusing on the  

administrative aspects of registering our customers' vehicles, to include checking documents and  

completing the administrative processes to ensure the smooth transition of vehicle ownership from  

Carvana to our customer. This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

  

**What you'll be doing:**


* Process, finalize and mail out customer registrations.
* Review customer paperwork for accuracy.
* Interacting with state and county government licensing departments, requiring in-person and


online document drop-off and pick-up, and receiving and filing paperwork with said  

agencies..Work closely with the local DMV; picking up, receiving and filing paperwork from the  

DMV.  

* Update customer records to ensure the most up to date information is available.
* Interact with team members across various lines of the business.
* Assisting other employees with customer follow-up.
* Input, cross-reference, and retrieve data from multiple internal and external databases.
* Maintain detailed notes within a customer tracking system.
* Other duties as assigned

  

**What the job requires:**



To be able to do your job at Carvana, there are some basic requirements we want to share with you.  

* 1+ years of work experience in an administrative or data entry capacity
* High School Diploma, GED, or equivalent education required.
* Ability to manage, organize, and reconcile multiple sources of information with accuracy.
* Ability to handle multiple tasks and priorities effectively.
* Computer literacy and data entry skills
* Ability to adapt to change.
* high energy, forward-thinking self-starter.
* Professional written and verbal communication skills.


This job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or  

responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may  

change at any time with or without notice.  

About Carvana  

We sell cars, but we're not salespeople. Since 2013, we've been making it our mission to change the way  

people search for, purchase, trade-in, finance, and receive used vehicles, and we're not taking our foot  

off of the gas anytime soon.  

Team spirit is evident at Carvana and every day we let our passion and creativity foster innovation. We  

take big swings, set ambitious goals, and challenge each other to make process-driven decisions in  

everything we do.  

We're seeking daring minds who can help us remain ahead of the curve and are committed to making a  

difference. If you like people and enjoy a positive, yet challenging and fun, work environment – we want  

you!

  

**Legal stuff**  

Hiring is contingent on passing a complete background check and a motor vehicle record check. This role  

is not eligible for visa sponsorship.



Carvana is an equal employment opportunity employer. All applicants receive consideration for  

employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or  

expression, marital status, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, protected veteran status, or  

genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. Carvana also prohibits harassment of  

applicants or employees based on any of these protected categories.

  

Please note this job description is not designed to contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or  

responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may  

change at any time with or without notice.

title: Car Detailer
description:
**We're looking for entry-level Lot Attendants** to build an exciting career at Carvana- the fastest-growing used automotive retailer in U.S. history and one of the four fastest companies to make the Fortune 500! As a Lot Attendant, you will be focused on maintaining the cleanliness and appearance of the vehicles at our Market Hubs. As part of this role, you will be expected to coordinate with fellow employees to ensure timely deliveries and the highest level of customer satisfaction. Interested in joining the team? Check out more below:


* Base compensation of $17.00/hour
* **This is a full time****position and requires open availability on weekdays and weekends**
* Competitive benefits that include medical, dental, vision, and matching 401k, along with other cool perks programs including student loan payments, discounts on vehicles, benefits for your pets, and much more
* PTO and paid holidays + your birthday is a holiday
* Location: Westport, CT 06880


We're looking for enthusiastic, energetic, and self-motivated team players to:


* Ensure each vehicle is inspected for mechanical, drivability or cosmetic concerns
* Wash and vacuum all inventory on a regular basis
* Complete multi-point inspection on arriving inventory to include fuel level, safety features, drivability test and proper display of all company and state disclosures
* Maintain positive relationships with coworkers and external vendors
* Interact and communicate with team members and management across all lines of the business.
* Must adhere to regular and predictable attendance.


**General qualifications and requirements**


* High School Diploma or equivalent is desirable
* Must be 18 years of age and have a valid driver's license
* Must have no more than 2 moving violations in the last 3 years or DUI
* Must be able to lift up to 60 pounds independently; majority of lifting from knee to shoulder heights; other lifting required from various levels.
* Must be able to carry and transport up to 60 pounds up to 20 feet.
* Requires standing for an extended period of time with frequent stretching, reaching, walking and stooping, pushing and/or pulling in an environment that may be cold, hot, noisy, and wet and may have fumes or odors due to vehicle maintenance.
* Requires working outdoors in all weather conditions.
* Requires excellent visual acuity and manual dexterity.
* Requires use of safety equipment that may include but not limited to face shield or goggles, non-slip shoes, gloves, mask, and other protective garments and equipment.
* Requires frequent driving and some typing.
* Must adhere to regular and predictable attendance.


**About Carvana**



At Carvana, we sell cars but we aren't car salesmen. Our promise is simple: we won't sell a car to a customer that we wouldn't sell to our own Mom. Period.



Being a brand ambassador of Carvana means having a passion for our vision and having a motor that never quits when it comes to representing our brand and values. Our Market Operations team members work as a team to deliver awesome customer experiences in their markets, while also remaining agile enough to keep up with the ever-changing beat and cadence of your daily activities.



Think you've got what it takes to join our team? Apply today!


*Carvana is an equal employment opportunity employer. All applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law. Carvana also prohibits harassment of applicants or employees based on any of these protected categories.*

title: Product Manager II - Security Integrations (SIEM)
description:
As Product Manager for security integrations you will be responsible for building compelling integrations with Datadog's security products, primarily for the Cloud SIEM product. You will work closely with security vendors, customers, and experts to understand what capabilities are available, what data sources are most valuable, and how Datadog can meet the needs of security operations and DevSecOps teams today. You will significantly increase the number of security integrations for Datadog. In pursuit of these goals, you will work with product teams across Datadog to identify opportunities to improve our existing integrations and create many new ones. You will also partner with engineers, designers, and go-to market teams to drive adoption across thousands of customers and multiple product lines.



Datadog Cloud SIEM helps security organizations monitor, detect, respond and act on threats present within their Cloud and IT environments. At Datadog, our goal is to make security easy for customers to adopt, with turn-key solutions and DevSecOps best practices.


*At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.*

  


**What You'll Do:**


* Build out an extensive and compelling library of security integrations that will drive growth and adoption of Datadog's security products
* Develop a deep understanding of the market landscape and identify key areas of competitive differentiation and market disruption
* Foster and maintain relationships with security vendors across the industry
* Work cross functionally with internal teams and external partners to deliver integrations consistently and reliably
* Maintain and report to product leadership on key metrics regarding security integration growth and adoption
* Articulate security value of integrations internally and with customers
* Discuss integration needs with customers and prospects and use their insights to drive product roadmap decisions
* Drive and own the security integration product requirements while working closely with key stakeholders including, customers, sales, engineering, threat researchers, designers, and other product management leaders to assure delivery
* Work closely with Executives, Marketing, Sales, PR, Design, and Support teams to successfully bring to the market new security integrations

  


#### **Who You Are:**


* At least 3+ years of Product Management experience in enterprise software serving a technical audience. A security background is preferred.
* Strong sense of ownership: will own and measure outcomes along with sales, technical solutions, products, etc.
* Ideally experience in direct or adjacent markets and domains: cybersecurity, application observability, security operations center teams, detection engineering, incident response, forensics, automation, Cloud-native security.
* Demonstrated ability to distill and present research findings, market analysis, and product requirements for both technical and non-technical audiences. Strong affinity for customer empathy, a keen eye for design and relationship building
* Demonstrated robust, structured, and data-driven problem-solving and prioritization skills, using strong verbal and written communications.


*Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you're passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.*

  


#### **Benefits and Growth:**


* New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)
* Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing
* Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking
* An inclusive company culture, the ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)
* Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions
* Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+
* Competitive global benefits


*Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.*


**About Datadog:**



Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers' entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center.


**Equal Opportunity at Datadog:**



Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference.


**Your Privacy:**



Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog's Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice.

title: Manager, Real Estate
description:
**You will…**


* Assist with all elements of transactions including acquisitions (buy, lease), divestments (sale, lease exits), and other portfolio related activities (renewals, subleases, amendments).
* Coordinate the transaction process end-to-end, including strategy development, overseeing market surveys and tours, coordinating site visits, alternative comparisons, developing the negotiating strategy, document review, help with and in some cases lead negotiating letters of intent and finalizing lease documents, approval preparation, signing, and close out reporting
* Partner with legal on document negotiation on leases, purchase and sale agreements, site plan approvals, acquiring development rights and multi-party easement agreements.
* Manage lease administration for national footprint of industrial, office, and last mile logistic assets
* Collaborate with various departments including Construction, Finance, Operations and Legal to ensure seamless execution of real estate strategies and to integrate into broader business planning
* Prepare monthly, quarterly presentations and reports on the real estate portfolio for the executive team
* Develop and maintain relationships with real estate owners, developers, brokers, bankers and consultants and outside counsel
* Develop management dashboards and establish relevant metrics to inform future decisions as part of a real estate and workplace strategy.


**Develop strategies for the management of the financial impact of real estate to minimization real estate expenses and enhance the optimization of operating expenses vs. square feet of facilities occupied**


* Evaluate real estate transactions on a financial pro forma basis and
* Prepare transaction memoranda to gain internal approval from executive leadership and the board
* Attend to facility related issues, working with vendors and internal teams to field requests and create processes.

  


**You are…**


* Experienced in commercial real estate with a strong grasp of fundamentals involving transaction management and property management in a corporate environment (incl. principles of real estate law)
* Highly organized, good with multitasking and possess the ability to relentlessly prioritize multiple projects at once and execute effectively.
* A great communicator with the ability to cultivate long-lasting partnerships while negotiating effectively
* Self-aware and have the ability to work with a diverse group of stakeholders, including cross-functionally with internal groups and externally with partners
* Analytically advanced and have familiarity with CRE technology applications and platforms.
* Adept at creating executive level presentations, including the ability to gather relevant data and information and communicate ideas effectively.
* Proficient in real estate in real estate financial analysis, discounted cash flows and analysis of real estate market data

  


**At a minimum, you have…**


* Bachelor's degree, preferably in Real Estate or Finance from a top-tier university
* Minimum of 4 years of commercial real estate (office, industrial or retail experience strongly preferred), brokerage, consulting or related experience
* Solid understanding of the relevant real estate markets and industry standards
* Clear and articulate verbal and written communication skills
* Expertise with Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Google Sheets
* Ability to build trust and relationships in a multi-national working environment
* Experience project managing cross-functional teams and dealing with complex business challenges in a rapidly changing environment
* Ability to balance multiple, often competing priorities
* Comfortable and willing to collaborate in-person frequently

  



This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the responsibilities. However, the Company reserves the right to adjust, modify, or reassign work tasks and responsibilities as needed to meet changing business needs, operational requirements, or other factors.

title: Middle School Mathematics Teacher
description:
Job Title: Middle School Mathematics Teacher  

Department: Middle School  

FLSA Status: Exempt  

The Hewitt School - New York, NY  

  

ABOUT HEWITT  

  

Established in 1920 and located in New York City, The Hewitt School is an independent K-12 girls’ school whose mission is to inspire girls and young women to become game changers and ethical leaders who forge an equitable, sustainable, and joyous future. Hewitt empowers and expects our community members to embrace multiple points of view, to engage others with empathy and integrity, and to champion equity and justice in all areas of our lives. As a community, Hewitt is fully committed to a culturally diverse faculty, staff, and student body.  

  

POSITION SUMMARY  

  

The Hewitt School seeks a full-time middle school mathematics teacher for the 2024-2025 school year. The successful candidate will have a deep appreciation for student-centered, engaging, and innovative teaching practices and will welcome the opportunity to collaborate with other educators in developing integrated, problem-based curricula.  

  

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES
* Teach three sections of eighth grade mathematics using the latest research-informed pedagogy
* Serve as a middle school advisor
* Integrate learning about equity and diversity and social emotional learning into academic and advisory programming
* Collaborate with department members on pedagogy and curricular scope and sequence
* Serve as a full member of the community by leading clubs, electives, or activities beyond classroom duties, attending school events such as concerts and games, and serving as proctor as needed
* Engage fully in Hewitt’s commitment to implementing current research on girls in the classroom and beyond
* Write student reports and stay in regular communication with parents
* Participate in admissions, parent education events, and serve on hiring committees as needed
* Write entries for the weekly divisional newsletters about class activities
* Chaperone field trips, including potential overnight trips

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED
* Demonstrated commitment to anti-bias education
* Bachelor’s degree in mathematics, mathematics education, or a related field
* A minimum of three years middle school teaching experience
* Commitment to girls’ education

QUALIFICATIONS DESIRED
* Master’s degree in mathematics or mathematics education
* Inquiry-based pedagogy
* Proficient with Mac platforms; comfortable with technology or demonstrated ability to learn quickly
* Culturally responsive approach to teaching
* Fluency in multiple student-centered instructional approaches
* Commitment to student life
* Proven dedication to professional growth and purpose-driven practice
* Professional practice and ability to model contemplation as part of intellectual exploration

SALARY RANGE  

  

Starting Salary Range: $65,000 to $95,000 (salary based upon, but not limited to, relevant experience and expertise)  

  

TO APPLY: Please submit a resumé, cover letter, and examples of previous relevant work via our applicant tracking portal. Cover letters should reflect a careful reading of The Hewitt School’s website, including the School’s academic philosophy. No phone calls, please. Recruitment will remain open until the position is filled; applicants should apply as soon as possible for consideration.  

  

IMPORTANT INFORMATION  

  

The Hewitt School is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It has been and will continue to be a fundamental policy of the School not to discriminate on the basis of any category prohibited by applicable federal, New York State and/or New York City laws/regulations. This policy applies to all aspects of the employment process, including hiring, promotion, demotion, compensation/benefits, performance evaluations, disciplinary actions, training, working conditions, layoff, and termination.

title: Specialist, Apartment Readiness
description:
**Position:** Specialist, Apartment Readiness
**FLSA Status:** Non-Exempt, Hourly
**Location:** New York, NY
**Worksite Status:** Onsite  


**Beam Living, a Blackstone portfolio company,** is a vertically integrated Real Estate management company that creates, manages, and supports communities throughout New York City.
We are focused on being **a great place to work, live & grow**. We are part of a very competitive NYC residential real estate market and need a very talented team to deliver on our promises to residents and to **communicate to the world why they should live in our communities.**
We are looking for someone to assist our Apartment Readiness Team in the role of **Specialist, Apartment Readiness.** If you are interested in making a positive impact on people’s lives by ensuring all new residents receive their apartment in perfect condition, then maybe you should work here.
**Only read further if you are:*** Kind
* Humble
* Honest
* Committed to leaving people and places better than you found them
* Someone who cares about building a great place for people to work, live & grow.


**You should be:*** Able to **think critically** to address resident/company concerns and resolve them accordingly.
* **A creator** who enjoys the challenge of solving complex problems.
* **Committed** to getting the job done under any circumstance and ensure the apartment is 100% complete prior to sign off.
* **An executor** who is passionately committed to excellence and will relentlessly pursue the team’s goals.
* **Nimble on your feet? Flexible?.** Things change.


**What you will do:*** **Inspect** both vacant and occupied apartments.
* **Communicate** with sub-contractors/vendors.
* Inspect and manage upwards of 20+ apartments daily and **consistently strive** to deliver the units in pristine condition and up to property standards.
* Work as a team and **manage your time** effectively in the field.
* Use **multiple technology platforms** to effectively conduct job responsibilities.
* Provide **professional interactions** with residents, SPS employees and sub-contractors daily.


**What you should have:*** **High attention to detail** to ensure we deliver a consistent product to future residents.
* **Fanatical discipline** and relentless desire to do what needs to be done.
* **General understanding (1 years+)** of general construction and customer service.
* A **love** **for organization** and keeping up with time management.
* A desire to **continually strive to do better** and take on ever increasing responsibility.


**What we offer:**We know that if we take care of our team, everything else will fall into place. We aren’t perfect, but we will try to set very clear expectations, always let you know where you stand, and do everything in our power to help you get where you want to go.
**Hourly Pay Rate:** $20.00 - $30.00
*Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience & location.*
A full slate of benefits that even includes things like paid parental leave.  

If any of that sounds interesting, then maybe we are a fit. Life is too short to work with people you don’t like. So whatever you do, don’t make that mistake.
**A few of the people you will work with:**
**Michael**
**Chris**
**Gerald**
**Taulant**
**City Life Just Got Happier**
**Beam Living believes that diversity, equity, and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a company. However, it is not enough to just BE diverse, diversity must be embraced! We want you to feel comfortable bringing your best self to work, which is why** **Beam Celebrates** **how diversity contributes to a welcoming inclusive environment where everyone belongs.**
**To further our commitment to fostering an environment that welcomes and embraces diversity, all employment decisions at Beam Living are based on individual qualifications, business needs and job requirements without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran or any other status protected by law.** This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

title: Service Technician
description:
**Position Description**  


**ABC Companies’** nine (9) world-class facilities routinely deliver service excellence and feature the latest diagnostic tools and state-of-the-art fabrication systems designed to cover a comprehensive range of transit bus, motorcoach and RV service and repair. In addition to a full line of diesel and gas commercial vehicle products ranging from vans to luxury buses, ABC is also a leader in fully electric commercial vehicles.
**Job Title:** Service Technician
**Reports To:** Operations Manager
**Scope:** This position is responsible for inspecting, diagnosing, repairing, and maintaining motor coaches and other commercial vehicles
**Benefits:** ABC Bus Companies benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, STD, LTD, Company Paid Life Insurance, Employee Assistance Program, & 401k match
**Pay Range:** $30 - $38 per hour
*This information reflects the proposed base salary range for this position based on available data. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. Individual pay is determined by additional factors including job related skills, experience, applicable education or training and other relevant factors.*
**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:*** Inspects, diagnoses, repairs, and maintains motorcoaches, commercial and non-commercial vehicles and other vehicles
* Understands and adheres to all company safety policies and procedures
* Compliance with all local, State, and Federal regulations applicable to operations, buildings, grounds, and personnel including EPA, OSHA, and DOT
* Specific duties and responsibilities are determined by Individual Service Technician training, certification, knowledge, skill, and experience

**Qualifications:**
* Requires good organizational skills to include the ability to effectively manage multiple projects, prioritize tasks, and complete assignments within expected time frames
* Employee must possess the tools necessary to complete assigned responsibilities
* Previous experience with Body and Frame Repairs
* Experience with Interior Component repair/replacement
* Audio/Video knowledge recommended not required
* A commercial driver license (CDL) is a plus!


**Skills:**
* Must be a self-starter and possess a positive attitude
* Must have a good attendance
* Must be willing to travel, with possible work on the weekends/overtime


**Physical Demands:**
* Ability to frequently move items weighing up to 100 pounds.


**This job description is subject to change at any time.**

title: Property Administrator
description:
**Company Overview:** 

Cambridge is a full service property management company specializing in condominium and homeowner associations. Our ability to view the needs of each individual association, allows us to offer personalized service at prices that are affordable.

At Cambridge, a team spirit prevails. Careful coordination and support of our office staff provides continuity and responsiveness in our services. Our office staff functions quickly and with precision. Phone inquiries are answered immediately, any problems that may arise, receive same day attention, and after hour emergencies are handled by Cambridge Management employees.

All accounting and data processing is done in-house on state-of-the-art computer systems by well trained professionals.

**Duties:**

* Become the primary point of contact for all homeowner and Board member inquiries via e-mail and phone, representing the company in a polite, professional and courteous manner.
* Compose letters regarding homeowner inquiries, complaints and requests in a timely and professional manner.
* Coordinate and oversee maintenance and repair work, ensuring timely completion and quality of work.
* Maintain accurate records of homeowner information, lease agreements, and property maintenance history, etc.
* Assist property managers with the preparation of mailings, annual budgets and financial reports.
* Collaborate with Board members, property owners, contractors and vendors to ensure smooth operations.

**Requirements**:

* Previous experience in property management or property administration is preferred but not mandatory.
* Proficiency in data entry and use of property management software (e.g. Enumerate) is preferred.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Outlook, etc.).
* Strong customer service skills with the ability to effectively communicate with homeowners, vendors and contractors to resolve conflicts.
* Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail.
* Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to negotiate effectively.

**Compensation:** 

* $20-25 per hour
* Salary is negotiable.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 30 per week

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Videographer
description:
**Freelance Sports Videographer** 

Mai Day Productions

**About Us:** Mai Day Productions is a leading video production company specializing in high-quality sports coverage. With the fall football season approaching, we're looking to expand our team of talented videographers who can capture the excitement and intensity of the game.

**Job Description:** We're seeking experienced Freelance Sports Videographers for the upcoming football season. If you have your own gear and a passion for filming live sports, especially football, we want to hear from you. This role requires availability on Friday nights and weekends, as that's when the action happens!

We have teams all over the state, so we're looking for videographers in all areas to apply. Whether you're in the north, south, or central regions, we'd love to have you on board.

**Responsibilities:**

* Film high school football games, capturing the fast-paced action on the field.
* Work closely with our production team to ensure footage meets our quality standards.
* Maintain and manage your own videography equipment.

**Requirements:**

* Experience in filming live sports, particularly football.
* Your own videography equipment (camera, lenses, tripods, etc.). Candidates with their own gear and reels will be given first priority.
* Strong portfolio or reels showcasing your sports videography skills.
* Availability on Friday nights and weekends is a must!
* Ability to work independently and meet tight deadlines.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Familiarity with different camera setups and filming techniques for live sports.
* Experience with video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro).
* Strong attention to detail and the ability to capture dynamic, engaging footage.

Pay ranging from $75-125 per game.

This role is on a per job payment basis. We look forward to seeing your work and potentially having you join our team at Mai Day Productions!

**How to Apply:** If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, we'd love to see your application. Please send us your resume, portfolio/reel, and a brief cover letter detailing your experience and the equipment you own. If you’ve made it this far and want a better chance at getting your application seen, email your resume, cover letter, and portfolio to paige@maidayproductions.com

Job Types: Part-time, Freelance

Schedule:

* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Filming: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Somerville, NJ 08876

description:

The Product Data Specialist will oversee the management of product data across our e-commerce platforms. This individual will have a robust understanding of Magento or similar platforms, ERP systems, and template management for uploading product data. title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Overview:

Vista is leading the change in private aviation, providing customers with the most advanced flying services and the very best value, anytime, anywhere around the world. We are the world’s leading private aviation group that is experiencing tremendous growth following landmark acquisitions and unprecedented demand from existing and new Members.  

The Administrative Assistant is responsible for various administrative duties in support of multiple departments in the NYC office. This role will join the team that serves as the primary contacts and friendly faces of the NYC Office as they greet and assist employees and visitors. This role reports to the Executive Assistant and works full time at the front desk.
Responsibilities:  

* Assisting visitors upon entry and exit of the building.
* Maintaining proper upkeep and cleanliness of the Café, breakrooms, and conference rooms.
* Maintaining the ordering, storage, inventory and distribution of office supplies and food/drink items.
* Conference room management and meeting set up.
* Assisting several departments with running daily reports or completing small tasks as needed.
* Complete expense reports monthly.
* Management of office mail and packages including shipping, receiving and distribution.
* Maintaining overall facility cleanliness and sanitation.
* Assisting with office events as needed.
* Miscellaneous company errands and other duties as assigned.


Required Skills and Experience:
* At least 1 year of administrative experience required preferably in a corporate office environment or similar.
* Superior interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills required. Proficiency in Microsoft Office.
* Ability to work well with different levels of employees and departments.
* Highly organized and able to multi-task and prioritize effectively. High energy and friendly demeanor.
* Ability to lift up to 15 pounds.


This role is paying $65,000 per year.

title: Security Site Supervisor - $24/hr
description:
**Field Inspector**

We help make your world a safer place.

Securitas is a global company that offers the most advanced and sustainable security solutions in the industry. We are located in 47 countries and have 355,000 employees worldwide and over 150,000 clients.

Securitas plays an essential role for our clients and in society. The **Security Field Inspector** position helps maintain a safe and secure environment for our clients by actively monitoring the premises, including patrolling a variety of locations. They preserve order while enforcing regulations and directives for a client site pertaining to personnel, visitors, and the area. Frequently our Security Officers will provide customer service and information to a client’s employees and customers.

We are driven by a clear corporate culture and purpose, which helps us live according to our values of Integrity, Vigilance, and Helpfulness. These values are at the heart of our culture, help define who we are and guide our actions.

No experience necessary! If you have retail, food service or hospitality industry background you are a great fit for this role; if not, we will provide you with the training and everything you need for a great introduction to a career in the security industry.

**Are you interested in being part of our Team?**

* Apply quickly and efficiently online
* Interview from the convenience of your own home
* Weekly pay
* Competitive benefits
* Flexible schedules

With over 80 years of protecting the things that matter, we’ve seen more than most. That’s why Securitas is the partner of choice for companies and an employer of choice for candidates worldwide.

title: Delivery Driver / Merchandiser
description:
**About the role**

As a Delivery Driver/Merchandiser, you play an essential role in the customer service experience providing a best-in-class delivery experience. You will deliver the customers’ purchases in a fast, safe and professional manor, build relationships and maintain Total Wine & More’s brand beyond the store. When not making deliveries, you will select and package on-line orders, process freight, stock shelves and help maintain all floor merchandise and inventory standards to ensure the store is organized and clean. You will report to the store management team.


Total Wine & More will provide a vehicle for deliveries. Car is not required.

**You will**

* Provide customer service by greeting and establishing a relationship with customers when delivering our products
* Follow all traffic and safety laws and operate vehicle in a safe manner, and able to drive during all inclement weather conditions
* Maintain road safety and cleanliness standards in TWM vehicle – comply with all company policies and guidelines
* Verify ID at time of delivery to prevent alcohol sales to a minor and refuse delivery to minors and intoxicated customers
* Load, tag and deliver merchandise to customers ordering online; resolve delivery inventory discrepancies
* Maintain all vehicle check forms including the sign in/out form, the vehicle damage check and pre-inspection forms
* Select and package products ordered on-line, and support in-store pick up, curbside pickup and delivery
* Complete freight process, ensure sorting area is safe and organized including unloading truck trailers, loading carts and distributing to correct locations; pull and tag merchandise from back room and overheads with visible conspicuous labels
* Maintain aisles by following established sorting and stocking guidelines
* Open and stack cases and merchandise; break down boxes and bale cardboard
* Ensure signage is correctly placed; build displays and end caps; clean and maintain merchandise
* Become familiar with and sharing Total Wine & More’s product portfolio

**What we're looking for**

* 21 years of age or older
* Have and maintain a clean motor vehicle record (MVR), including 5 years without any major traffic violations and 3 years without a minor traffic violation
* Work a flexible schedule as business requires, which may also depend on your preference for part-time or full-time hours
* Experience using technology applicable to the position and access information necessary to complete daily responsibilities
* 1-year delivery, retail sales associate, merchandiser, or inventory specialist experience preferred, to include greeting customers and managing inventory
* Strong interpersonal skills with a positive and engaging attitude
* Value collaboration and acting as a team player
* Desire to develop knowledge of product and services

**Physical Requirements (with or without accommodations)**

* Walk, climb ladders, bend down repeatedly, and be on feet for 8-10 hours a day
* Lift and carry 50lbs and take 100lb dollies up-stairs

**We offer**

* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Generous store discounts
* Health care plans (medical, prescription, dental, vision)
* 401(k), HSA, FSA, Pre-tax commuter benefits
* Disability and life insurance coverage
* Paid parental leave
* Pet insurance
* Critical illness and accident insurance
* Discounted home and auto insurance
* College tuition assistance
* Career development, industry knowledge, and wine, spirits, and beer education
* Consumer classes
* & More!

**Grow with us!**


Total Wine & More is the country’s largest independent retailer of fine wine, beer and spirits, and we continue to grow our footprint year over year. Total Wine offers exciting and unique career opportunities across the country and in our corporate office. Our strength is our people. We have a commitment to training and career growth, all in an environment that values new ideas and teamwork. If you share our entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for providing best-in-class customer experience, take a moment to apply or learn more at www.TotalWine.com/About-us/Careers!

*Total Wine & More considers several factors when establishing compensation. Estimated salaries determined by third parties have not been validated by Total Wine & More.*

*Total Wine & More is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without discrimination based on race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Total Wine & More makes reasonable accommodations during all aspects of the employment process, including during the interview process. Total Wine & More is a Drug Free Workplace.*

*The information provided above indicates the general nature and level of work required of the position and is not a comprehensive list of all responsibilities or qualifications. Benefits list is only a highlight of some of the benefits offered to team members; eligibility for certain benefits apply.*

title: Warehouse Counter Sales / Warehouse Associate
description:
**WAREHOUSE ASSOCIATE / COUNTER SALES**

*How would you like to work with an outstanding team in our family run business? Stickel Packaging is one of the leading Packaging Distributors in New Jersey. Since 1987, we have built our company around unparalleled customer service and strong family values.*

**This role is a somewhat hybrid role.....heavy direct customer interaction in a sales capacity in the warehouse, but also the ability to fill orders from the warehouse directly to the consumer, which may involve driving a forklift. Hours will probably be 8am to 430pm.**

**Expectations and Responsibilities:**

* Receiving, processing, labeling, and storing incoming stock
* Inspecting all stock for damages and keeping records of damages
* Taking customer orders from the NEW Warehouse Sales Counter
* Entering orders into the ERP system & confirming prices
* Organizing the warehouse counter space & surrounding area
* Preparing orders for shipment
* Operating stock management tools; for example, a forklift
* Counting stock and keeping inventory record

**Experience:**

* A high school diploma nor relevant work experience
* Prior experience working in warehouse a plus.
* Prior experience working in Customer Service / Sales
* Excellent time management and organizational skills
